stories.text:
This morning I started getting a lot of spam on my personal Gmail account. It’s crazy because Gmail even marked them as “important”. Have they “cracked” the formula to beat Google’s spam filters?

Screenshot of my inbox (they keep coming as I’m typing this): https://gcdn.pbrd.co/images/oufkAAQmotxm.png?o=1
stories.title: Ask HN: Anybody else getting a lot of Spam (Gmail)?

Virtual Machine for iOS and Mac
BBC licence fee to be abolished in 2027 and funding frozen

stories.text:
I want to build a command line tool with context-sensitive completion. This is important because it allows interactive exploration of the options -- both of the application and of the current data model -- available to the user.

So far this is what I've found.

https://github.com/desertbit/grumble

https://github.com/spf13/cobra

https://github.com/urfave/cli

https://github.com/abiosoft/ishell

I would like to know people's experiences and recommendations in building such an app in go.
stories.title: Ask HN: What libraries does go have for building interactive shells?
ELF 101 a Linux Executable Walkthrough by Ange Albertini [pdf]
